description:
Kurogane Yaiba is a boy who doesn't want to become what any regular kid would: He wants to be a samurai. That's why he undergoes a hard training with his father, knowing only the forest as his world. Then, one day, he is sent to Japan, where he has to deal with a whole new civilized reality, meeting the Mine family, the evil Onimaru and even the legendary Musashi, having lots of dangerous adventures, becoming stronger everyday.

(Source: Anime News Network)

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/akitaroh_le) | [Website](http://www5c.biglobe.ne.jp/~akitaroh/) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/大地丙太郎)

He is a Tokyo Polytechnic University graduate. Although Daichi was an aspiring stage photographer he instead joined animation photography company Tokyo Animation Film where he continued to work for 5 years, although he temporarily changed jobs and shot live-action karaoke videos instead. In 1991 he left his employer, worked at a game production for half a year, and returned to the animation industry where he would study under animation director [Tetsuo Yasumi](https://anilist.co/staff/111207/). Daichi would advance into episode direction and caught the eyes of [Tatsuo Satou](https://anilist.co/staff/100391/) and [Hiroaki Sakurai](https://anilist.co/staff/101153/) who were impressed with his work on [*Akazukin Chacha*](https://anilist.co/anime/103/Akazukin-Chacha). Daichi made his solo directorial debut in 1995 with [*Nurse Angel Ririka SOS*](https://anilist.co/anime/616/Nurse-Angel-Ririka-SOS). Since 2015 he serves as scriptwriter and director for [*Kodomo no Omocha*](https://anilist.co/anime/1486/Kodomo-no-Omocha/)'s stage version of which he directed the anime as well. Presently he's a freelance director.

**Style**
He specializes in high-tension comedy and often includes comedy and lighthearted moments even in more serious works. In his comedies he often smoothly deforms the characters far beyond their design, inspired by gag manga king [Fujio Akatsuka](https://anilist.co/staff/97141/). His directing work tends to include live-action images or brief flashbacks from past episodes. Since childhood Daichi became affected and inspired by the works of famous jidaigeki actor *Joushirou Konoe* inspiring him to make more historical samurai works.

Daichi is particular about choosing voice actors and has discovered several talents such as [Ayaka Saitou](https://anilist.co/staff/95222/), [Nozomi Sasaki](https://anilist.co/staff/95580/), and [Reiko Yasuhara](https://anilist.co/staff/95373/). 

**Accolades**
- [*Ojarumaru*](https://anilist.co/anime/4459/Ojarumaru) won the 1999 Japan Media Arts Festival Animation Excellence Award.
- [*Maksete Iruka!*](https://anilist.co/anime/2791/Makasete-Iruka/) won the 2004 Japan Media Arts Festival Animation Excellence Award.
- [*Gyagu Manga Biyori*](https://anilist.co/anime/1196/Gyagu-Manga-Biyori) was recommended by the Japan Media Arts Festival Animation committee in 2005.

**Controversies**
In 2018 and 2019 voice actress [Hiroko Konishi](https://anilist.co/staff/96545/Hiroko-Konishi) alleged that she was propositioned by her manager to enter a mixed bath with Daichi in the nude and was blacklisted from the voice acting industry when she refused.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/akitaroh_le) | [Website](http://www5c.biglobe.ne.jp/~akitaroh/) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/大地丙太郎)

- [*Gyagu Manga Biyori*](https://anilist.co/anime/1196/Gyagu-Manga-Biyori) was recommended by the Japan Media Arts Festival Animation committee in 2005.

**Controversies**
In 2018 and 2019 voice actress [Hiroko Konishi](https://anilist.co/staff/96545/Hiroko-Konishi) alleged that she was propositioned by her manager to enter a mixed bath with Daichi in the nude and was blacklisted from the voice acting industry when she refused.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/加戸誉夫)

Currently part of [Studio Mother](https://anilist.co/studio/6638/). Former long-time member of [Xebec](https://anilist.co/studio/27/). Originally from [Ashi Productions](https://anilist.co/studio/196/), which he joined after graduating from Osaka University of Arts in 1985.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/加戸誉夫)

Currently part of [Studio Mother](https://anilist.co/studio/6638/). Former long-time member of [Xebec](https://anilist.co/studio/27/). Originally from [Ashi Productions](https://anilist.co/studio/196/), which he joined after graduating from Osaka University of Arts in 1985.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/千羽由利子)

One of the nine founders of [OLM](https://anilist.co/studio/28/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/64664693)

Yamamoto's interest in working in the anime industry piqued in high school after realizing how noticeable the difference in episodes were depending on the episode director in charge. One of his favourites shows included [Seisenshi Dunbine](https://anilist.co/anime/929/).

In the late '80s, he joined [Sunrise](https://anilist.co/studio/14/) as a production assistant after finding out that it's how many of the studio's directors started off. There he met and studied under [Shuuji Iuchi](https://anilist.co/staff/115833/) on his shows [Madou King Granzort](https://anilist.co/anime/2818/) and [Mashin Eiyuuden Wataru](https://anilist.co/anime/4807/). Then after having gone freelance he got his first shot as a director as one of the three unit directors on Iuchi's [Ranma ½ film](https://anilist.co/anime/418/) in 1991.

In 2001, Yamamoto made his debut as a series director on [Shiawase Sou no Okojo-san](https://anilist.co/anime/2934/), soon after which he worked as the first director of the long-running [Keroro Gunsou](https://anilist.co/anime/516/). In 2006 he directed the well-received [NHK ni Youkoso!](https://anilist.co/anime/1210/)

More recent directorial works of his include [Yama no Susume](https://anilist.co/anime/14355/) and [Shounen Maid](https://anilist.co/anime/21321/).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/谷口守泰)

A veteran animator with a career spanning nearly 60 years.

Akio Takami is an animator, animation supervisor and character designer. Originally a member of Ashi Productions, he joined Xebec in the 90s, where he participated in most of Xebec's works and became one of the key people at the studio.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Sunma47) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/三間雅文)

One of the industry's most prolific sound directors, having worked on more than 300 productions.

After having graduated college, Mima joined Magic Capsule, a sound production company ran by his relative [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062/). In 1986, he debuted as a sound director on [MD Geist](https://anilist.co/anime/1285/MD-Geist/). He left Magic Capsule in 1996, and later joined Techno Sound. In 2004, he became the studio's representative director.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/寺田憲史)

Terada's more notable works include writing the first three games of the Final Fantasy series. He also worked on Batman: Dark Tomorrow, created the concept for the Sega CD game Dark Wizard, and was the main script writer for the [Kimagure Orange Road](https://anilist.co/anime/1087/) series among other things.
_Note: Not to be confused with the [composite artist](https://anilist.co/staff/154403/)._
_Note: Not to be confused with the [composite artist](https://anilist.co/staff/154403/)._

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kenokun)

Kouhei attended Tokyo National University of Fine Arts and Music (Music Faculty, Composition Department), studying under Tomojirou Ikenouchi and other professors. He worked for three consecutive years at Victor Music Industries after he graduated from the University. He attended Berklee College of Music for two years after he left Victor Music Industries. After returning to Japan, Kouhei started his activities as a composer.

Though Kouhei had been playing at the hotel at first, he was requested to compose an insert song for "Arcadia of My Youth: Endless Orbit SSX", a 1982 TV anime, and it became his first work as a composer. Afterwards, he handled some more compositions of insert songs, this time for the Super Sentai series and he also did the composition of the background music for a TV anime, Konpora Kid, in 1985.

Notably, the score for [Top wo Nerae! Gunbuster](https://anilist.co/anime/949/) made his name and talent very famous among anime fans, and is recognized as one of his most important works. He also handled the composition of [Top wo Nerae 2! Diebuster](https://anilist.co/anime/1002/) and showed a peculiar arrangement, which he added to his previous 17-year-old work. Another of his most important work is often said to be [Yuusha-Ou GaoGaiGar](https://anilist.co/anime/890/), and the [sequel](https://anilist.co/anime/1382/) following it.

In 2002, he won the first Tokyo Anime Award for Best Music for his work on [Overman King Gainer](https://anilist.co/anime/1792/).

He is an anime producer and planner. He was formerly working at [OB Planning](https://anilist.co/studio/67/), before establishing OLM, where he is still currently the representative director and founder of it with [Yuriko Chiba](https://anilist.co/staff/103307/) and [Naohito Takahashi](https://anilist.co/staff/105248/).

Toshihiro Nakazawa is a producer and board director at Shogakukan-Shueisha Productions (FKA: Shogakukan Productions). He was formerly a board director at SynergySP (FKA: Synergy Japan) and later serving as its representative director until retiring from his position in 2014, after SynergySP became independent from Shogakukan-Shueisha Productions.
